intro: Armeria maritima var. multiceps, commonly known as the coastal thrift, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to coastal areas of the western United States. It features dense clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in sandy, well-drained soils. It is well adapted to salt spray and wind, making it a hardy species for coastal gardens. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
